claims.title: Negligent Non-Compliance with FCRA - Inaccurate Reporting
claims.description: The CRA failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in a consumer's credit report, resulting in the reporting of inaccurate information. [cite: 47, 51]
elements: The CRA reported inaccurate information about the plaintiff.
The CRA failed to follow reasonable procedures to assure accuracy.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages as a result.
The CRA's failure was negligent.

claims.title: Willful Non-Compliance with FCRA - Inaccurate Reporting
claims.description: The CRA willfully failed to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in a consumer's credit report. This implies a knowing or reckless disregard for the law.
elements: The CRA reported inaccurate information about the plaintiff.
The CRA willfully failed to follow reasonable procedures or had a pattern of such failures.
The failure was a conscious disregard of the consumer's rights or a reckless action.
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

claims.title: Negligent Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation
claims.description: After receiving a dispute from a consumer, the CRA negligently failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information was inaccurate. [cite: 48]
elements: The plaintiff disputed the accuracy of an item in their file with the CRA.
The CRA failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of the disputed item.
The failure to reinvestigate was negligent.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages due to the continued inaccurate reporting.

claims.title: Willful Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation
claims.description: After receiving a dispute from a consumer, the CRA willfully failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation, demonstrating a knowing or reckless disregard for its obligations. [cite: 48]
elements: The plaintiff disputed an item with the CRA.
The CRA's failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation was willful (done knowingly or with reckless disregard).
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

claims.title: Violation of NY FCRA - Failure to Conduct Reasonable Reinvestigation
claims.description: The CRA violated the New York Fair Credit Reporting Act by failing to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation after the consumer disputed erroneous information. [cite: 62]
elements: The CRA prepared a consumer report with erroneous information. [cite: 60]
The plaintiff disputed the information. [cite: 39]
The CRA failed to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation.
The plaintiff suffered damages.

claims.title: Violation of NY FCRA - Failure to Delete Inaccurate Information
claims.description: The CRA violated the New York Fair Credit Reporting Act by failing to delete or modify disputed information after it could not be verified. [cite: 63, 64]
elements: A reinvestigation did not or could not verify the accuracy of disputed information.
The CRA failed to delete or modify the information from the plaintiff's file.
The plaintiff suffered damages as a result.

causes_of_action.category: Claims Against Furnishers of Information (e.g., Banks)

claims.title: Negligent Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation (Furnisher)
claims.description: After receiving notice of a dispute from a CRA, the furnisher of information (e.g., a bank) negligently failed to conduct its own reasonable investigation into the disputed information. [cite: 54]
elements: The plaintiff disputed information with a CRA. [cite: 39]
The CRA notified the furnisher of the dispute. [cite: 40]
The furnisher failed to conduct a reasonable investigation.
The furnisher's failure was negligent.
The plaintiff suffered actual damages.

claims.title: Willful Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation (Furnisher)
claims.description: After receiving notice of a dispute from a CRA, the furnisher of information willfully failed to conduct a reasonable investigation, demonstrating a knowing or reckless disregard for its duties. [cite: 54]
elements: The plaintiff disputed information with a CRA. [cite: 39]
The CRA notified the furnisher of the dispute. [cite: 40]
The furnisher's failure to conduct a reasonable investigation was willful.
The plaintiff suffered damages (actual, statutory, and potentially punitive).

violations.title: Failure to Assure Maximum Possible Accuracy
violations.description: A CRA must follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

violations.title: Failure in Reinvestigation Duties
violations.description: Requires CRAs to conduct a free, reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information within 30 days of receiving a consumer's dispute.

violations.title: Failure to Consider Consumer-Submitted Information
violations.description: During a reinvestigation, a CRA must review and consider all relevant information submitted by the consumer.

violations.title: Failure to Delete or Modify Inaccurate Information
violations.description: If a reinvestigation finds information to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, the CRA must promptly delete or modify the item from the consumer's file.

violations.title: Furnisher's Failure to Reasonably Investigate
violations.description: After receiving a notice of dispute from a CRA, a furnisher must conduct an investigation, review all relevant information, and report results to the CRA.

violations.title: Furnisher's Failure to Review All Relevant Information
violations.description: A furnisher, in conducting its investigation, must review all relevant information provided to it by the CRA.

violations.title: Civil Liability for Non-Compliance
violations.description: These sections establish civil liability for willful (§ 1681n) and negligent (§ 1681o) non-compliance with the FCRA, allowing for actual, statutory, and punitive damages, as well as attorney's fees and costs. [cite: 57]

legal_violations.statute: New York Fair Credit Reporting Act (NY FCRA)

violations.title: Prohibition of Inaccurate Information
violations.description: Prohibits a CRA from reporting information it knows or has reason to believe is inaccurate.

violations.title: Failure to Reinvestigate and Correct
violations.description: Mandates that CRAs reinvestigate disputed items and correct any inaccuracies found.

violations.title: Failure to Delete After Failed Verification
violations.description: Requires CRAs to delete or modify information that cannot be verified after a reinvestigation.

violations.title: Civil Liability for Non-Compliance (NY)
violations.description: Establishes civil liability for violations of the NY FCRA, allowing for actual and punitive damages, as well as costs and reasonable attorney's fees.
